DESCRIPTION.P: Armax processes can be coded with Scilab tlist of type 'ar'. armac is used to build Armax scilab object. An 'ar' tlist contains the fields ['a','b','d','ny','nu','sig'].

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: armac
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : this function creates a Scilab tlist which code an Armax process A(z^-1)y= B(z^-1)u + D(z^-1)sig*e(t)

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: armap(ar [,out])
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Display the armax equation associated with ar

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: armap_p(ar [,out])
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Display the armax equation associated with ar using polynomial matrix display.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: [A,B,D]=armap2p(ar)
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : extract polynomial matrices from ar representation

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: armax
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : is used to identify the coefficients of a n-dimensional ARX process A(z^-1)y= B(z^-1)u + sig*e(t)

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: armax1
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : armax1 is used to identify the coefficients of a 1-dimensional ARX process A(z^-1)y= B(z^-1)u + D(z^-1)sig*e(t)

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: arspec
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Spectral power estimation of armax processes. Test of mese and arsimul

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: exar1
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : An Example of ARMAX identification ( K.J. Astrom) The armax process is described by : a=[1,-2.851,2.717,-0.865] b=[0,1,1,1] d=[1,0.7,0.2]

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: exar2
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : ARMAX example ( K.J. Astrom). A simulation of a bi dimensional version of the example of exar1.

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: exar3
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Spectral power estimation of arma processes from Sawaragi et all where a value of m=18 is used. Test of mese and arsimul

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.label: odedi
DESCRIPTION_ITEM.SP: : Simple tests of ode and arsimul. Tests the option 'discret' of ode
